definition: to venture to/to presume to/to take the liberty of
to put into (one's pockets, clothes)/Taiwan pr. [chuai3]
to emit/to give off/to send out (or up, forth)/to brave/to face/reckless/to falsely adopt (sb's identity etc)/to feign/(literary) to cover

sentences.english: She offered a few ideas to improve the plan.
sentences.chinese: 我将不揣冒昧，提出一个修改意见。

sentences.english: I took the liberty of reminding her of the real facts.
sentences.chinese: 我不揣冒昧地提醒她注意事实。

sentences.english: I will venture to send a suggested correction of it.
sentences.chinese: 我将不揣冒昧，提出一个修改意见。

definition: lit. a brick thrown to prompt others to produce a jade (idiom)/fig. a modest suggestion intended to prompt others to come forward with better ideas
(courteous) to be so bold as to
my unworthy manuscript (humble expr.)/my humble writing
my limited view (lit. view through a thin tube)/my limited understanding/my opinion (humble)
lit. throw out a brick and get jade thrown back (idiom)/fig. to attract others' interest or suggestions by putting forward one's own modest ideas to get the ball rolling
(humble expr.) of humble talent and shallow learning (idiom); Pray forgive my ignorance,...
learned person/expert in a certain field/abbr. to 方家[fang1 jia1]
